solution_line_template: Alyssa used half of the candles, which is {alyssa_fraction}*{total_candles} = <<{alyssa_fraction}*{total_candles}={alyssa_used_candles}>>{alyssa_used_candles} candles
The number of candles that remained is {total_candles}-{alyssa_used_candles} = <<{total_candles}-{alyssa_used_candles}={remaining_candles_after_alyssa}>>{remaining_candles_after_alyssa}

Chelsea used 70% of the remaining candles, a total of {chelsea_percentage}*{remaining_candles_after_alyssa} = <<{chelsea_percentage}*{remaining_candles_after_alyssa}={chelsea_used_candles}>>{chelsea_used_candles} candles.

The total number of candles in the room now is {total_candles} - {alyssa_used_candles}-{chelsea_used_candles} = <<{total_candles}-{alyssa_used_candles}-{chelsea_used_candles}={candles_remaining_in_room}>>{candles_remaining_in_room}
